"WHY THE HELL HASN'T IT BEEN FIXED BY NOW!!!" you may be asking yourself?  Well because the publisher of the game, Sierra,  was bought out by Activison about a year after this came out.   They then shut down the entire Dev team responsible for this game, and oddly enough canceled production of it.  It's really weird when you think about it because this game filled in the wii sandbox niche market perfectly.

Theres no chance of a patch ever coming out for this.

But you can sort of fix it.  If you go into MSCONFIG.EXE you can switch the number of processers from 2 (or 4, depending on whether your running on quad or duo) to 1.  THIS MAY NOT WORK.  I'm running Windows 7, 64 bit, and it didn't work for me.  But apparently it does work on 32 bit systems.

There is nothing wrong with the game or its compatibility with vista or 7, however this game is not compatible with multi-core processors on 7 and vista, mainly with nvidia cards. To fix...
1. Go to the run/search menu and type "msconfig" and press enter.
2. Go to the "boot" tab
3. Click "Advanced options..."
4. Check the "Number of Processors" box and set it to 1.
5. Restart and play the game

You'll need to remember to switch it back and restart again when your not playing so your computer will run on all cores.
